text: Richard James Gill (4 November 1941 – 28 October 2018) was an Australian conductor of choral, orchestral and operatic works. He was known as a music educator and for his activism for music education of children. He was born in Sydney. He was awarded Order of Australia Medal in 1994.Gill, Richard James – Medal of the Order of Australia , It's an Honour website, Australian Government In 1969, he was the founding conductor of the Strathfield Symphony Orchestra in Sydney.Strathfield Symphony – About He continued as conductor in 1973–74 and returned in 1979 to conduct the orchestra's 10th anniversary concert. In 2014, he was made musical director of the Sydney Chamber Choir. He composed the music for Brisbane Girls Grammar School school song, "Nil sine labore"."School Song" , Gazette, Spring 2010, p. 43 Gill died in Sydney on 28 October 2018 from colorectal and peritoneal cancer at the age of 76. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Deaths from peritoneal cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Sydney Category:Australian conductors Category:Australian activists Category:Writers from Sydney
title: Richard Gill (conductor)
